event: Charles Barkley scored 56 points on 23-of-31 shooting as the Suns beat the Warriors 140–133 to complete a first-round sweep.
Reggie Miller scores 8 points in 9 seconds to stun the Knicks in 1995.
Michael Jordan scored 226 points in the Bulls’ five-game Eastern Conference first round series against Cleveland, breaking Bernard King’s record of 213 set in 1984.
Led by Andre Iguodala’s 20 points, the 8-seed 76ers upset the 1-seed Bulls in Game 6 to win their first-round series. It marked the second straight year a No. 8 beat a No. 1 in Round 1.
The Blazers beat the Suns 153–151 in 2OT in Game 4 of the West Semis — the highest-scoring NBA Playoff game ever. Portland won the series in 5.
Kawhi Leonard’s iconic corner buzzer-beater over Joel Embiid bounced in after four rim bounces, lifting the Raptors to a 92–90 Game 7 win over the 76ers.
Philadelphia’s Allen Iverson recorded an NBA playoff-record 10 steals in a 97-85 win over the Orlando Magic.
Larry Bird scored 27 points and Cedric Maxwell added 19 to lead Boston to a 102-91 victory over Houston in Game 6 of the Finals, giving the Celtics their 14th NBA Championship.
Magic Johnson notched a playoff record 24 assists as the Lakers beat Phoenix 118-102 in Game 2 of the West Finals.
Rookie Magic Johnson filled in for Kareem at center and delivered 42 points, 15 boards, and 7 assists as the Lakers beat the Sixers 123–107 in Game 6 to win the title.
Michael Jordan hit a contested fadeaway at the buzzer over Gerald Wilkins to beat the Cavs 103–101 in Game 4, sending the Bulls to their third straight Finals.
Rick Barry hit a jumper with 38 seconds remaining to put Game 1 of the NBA Finals out of reach as Golden State defeated Washington 101-95.
A Game 4 win against the Portland Trail Blazers in the Western Conference finals sends the Golden State Warriors to The Finals for a fifth straight postseason.
The Bulls beat the Pistons 105–97 in Game 2 of the East Finals, setting an NBA playoff record with their 15th straight home win.
In a classic Game 7 duel, Dominique Wilkins (47 pts) and Larry Bird (34 pts, 20 in the 4th) traded shots before the Celtics edged the Hawks 118–116 in the 1988 East Semis.
Paul Pierce scored 19 in the 4th to outscore the Nets and erase a 21-point deficit, leading the Celtics to a 94–90 Game 3 win — the biggest comeback in NBA Playoff history.
The Chicago Bulls defeat the Detroit Pistons in Game 4 to clinch the franchise’s first trip to The Finals.
Klay Thompson hit an NBA playoff-record 11 threes to lead the Warriors’ 108–101 comeback win over the Thunder in Game 6 of the West Finals.
Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James scored the team’s final 25 points in a double-overtime win against the Detroit Pistons in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference finals.
Indiana’s Reggie Miller drilled an NBA playoffs record five 3-pointers in the fourth quarter of the Pacers’ 93-86 win over host New York in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference finals.
Golden State’s Stephen Curry nails nine 3-pointers in a 122-103 win in Game 2 vs. the Cleveland Cavaliers, breaking Ray Allen’s record for the most 3-pointers in an NBA Finals game.
Down 15 in the 4th, the Lakers rally past the Blazers in Game 7 of the West Finals, sealing it with a Kobe-to-Shaq alley-oop with 40 seconds left.
Patrick Ewing posted 24 points and 22 rebounds to lead the Knicks past the Pacers 94–90 in Game 7, sending New York to its first Finals since 1973.
Philadelphia held Los Angeles center Kareem Abdul-Jabbar to his all-time playoff low of six points and trounced the Lakers 135-102 in Game 5 of the NBA Finals.
The Bulls crushed the Jazz 96–54 in the most lopsided NBA Finals game ever. Utah’s 54 points marked the fewest in the shot clock era.
Jerry West hits a 60-foot shot to force overtime in 1970 NBA Finals Game 3.
Michael Jordan's 'Flu Game' leads Bulls to victory in 1997 NBA Finals Game 5.
Cedric Maxwell scored 24 points as the Celtics beat the Lakers 111–102 in Game 7, securing their 15th NBA title at Boston Garden.
The Detroit Pistons completed a Finals sweep of the Los Angeles Lakers with a 105-97 Game 4 victory, winning the first NBA title in franchise history.
Michael Jordan clinches his sixth championship with Bulls in 1998 NBA Finals Game 6.
Tim Duncan and the San Antonio Spurs win their fifth NBA title, defeating the Miami Heat 104-87 in Game 5 and taking The NBA Finals 4-1. Rising star Kawhi Leonard is the Finals MVP.
The Warriors beat the Cavs 105–97 in Game 6 of the 2015 Finals, winning their first title since 1975. Andre Iguodala was named Finals MVP.
The Celtics won their 17th title by crushing the Lakers 131–92 in Game 6 — the most lopsided Finals closeout ever. Paul Pierce earned Finals MVP.
Ray Allen's clutch three-pointer forces overtime in 2013 NBA Finals Game 6.
Shaquille O’Neal won unanimous Finals MVP in 2000 after averaging 38 points and 16.7 rebounds in the Lakers’ 6-game win, capped by a 116–111 Game 6 victory.
LeBron James and the Heat won their second straight title, beating the Spurs 95–88 in Game 7. LeBron earned back-to-back Finals MVP honors.
